* Duke Class is the main class that will run based on the different commands given
* by the user. Available commands include todo, event, deadline, mark, unmark, delete.
* Sends the commands input by the user to the Parser Class for processing.
* Starts up and runs the Duke program.
* Event Class is a type of task the user can create.
* Two sets of date and time is required as an input for the event.
public Event(String task, String taskType, String start, String end) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event for the user to view.
* Returns a string representation of date and time of the deadline.

* @return String representation of start the date and time of event.
* Returns a string representation of the end date and time of the event.

* Parser Class is responsible for interpreting the commands entered by the user. Upon invalid commands, exceptions
* Method is responsible for interpreting commands send by the user and handling invalid commands.
public void input(String commandInput, Duke duke, TaskList taskList) {

* Storage Class is responsible for the loading and saving of the data.txt file upon exiting the program.
* Method is responsible for loading the contents in the txt for the Duke program to use.

* Method is responsible for saving the updated TaskList after the user has finished inputting commands.
* The data.txt will be updated upon the termination of Duke program.
* Task Class is the parent class for all Task subclasses such as ToDo, Deadline and Event.
* Task Class contains information such as the Tasktype, TaskDescription and TaskStatus/
* Gets the completion status of the task for printing to terminal.
* Gets the completion status of the task in binary values when saving the file into txt.

* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.

* ToDo Class is a type of task the user can create.
* Informs the user a new ToDo has been created.

* Ui Class is responsible for interacting with the user.
